othermeta.content: Describes how to update existing documents by uploading new versions.

context.p: Documents are checked out to incorporate any modifications to the existing file at any point in time. A checked-out document cannot be modified by other users to prevent overwriting and loss of information. The user name of the user who checked-out the document is displayed in the document list.
Documents wrongly checked out can be restored to their current version by choosing the Discard Check Out option. You can discard a check-out only before the document is checked-in.
On making modifications to a checked-out document, the document must be checked-in by the user who had checked out the document. On checking-in a document, document version number increments by 1.

li.p: From the documents list page, select the appropriate document.
Click Check In/Out, and then click Check Out.
The file is downloaded to the local storage. If you want to discard the check-out, click Check In/Out, and then click Discard Check Out.
Make required modifications to the document, and save the document.
In the documents list page, select the checked-out document.
ClickCheck In/Out, and then clickCheck In.
In theComments box, enter the details about the modification as comments.
In the New Document box, click Choose File to select the modified document, select the updated document, and then click Open.
In Document Type, select the appropriate option.

The version number of the document increments by 1.
For information on document versions, refer toManaging Document Versions.
